intro: Ficus sycomorus var. polybotrya, commonly known as the African sycamore or the sacred fig, is a variant of the sacred fig tree native to parts of Africa. It is a large, evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 30 meters, characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and smooth, gray bark. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by spherical, greenish fruits that turn yellow when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in forested areas. This species is also valued for its ecological importance and has cultural significance in various African societies.
